definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: forget (NH id.; As. nišîtu perh. forgottenness Dl:HWB 486; Aram. [[נְשָׁא]] (esp. Ithpe., Aph.), n4o0 forget; Ar. nasiya forget, neglect; cf. Eth. n4h.laya: ignoscere, condonare, indulgere Di:633);—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. 1 s. [[וְנׇשִׁיתִי]] [[אֶתְכֶם נׇשׁאׁ]] Je 23:39 I will forget you finally (but LXX Vulgate SyrVer Che Gie [[וְנׇשָׂאתִי]], sq. [[וְנׇטַשְׁתִּי]] as v:Je 23:33 b, v. III. [[מַשָּׂא]]); [[נׇשִׁיתִי טוֹבָה]] La 3:17 I have forgotten prosperity; Impf. 1 s. [[הַאֶשֶּׁה]] shall I forget ? i.e. overlook, rd. by We Mic 6:10 plausibly for MT [[הַאִשׁ]]; Inf. abs. [[נׇשׁאׁ]] ([[א]] ´[[ל]]) Je 23:39 (v. supr.).

definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Impf. 2 ms. sf. [[תִּנׇּשֵׁנִי]] Is 44:21 thou shalt not be forgotten of me, but dub.; Ges:§ 117* [[תִּנְשֵׁנִי]] (Qal); Che:Hpt [[תִּטְּשֵׁנִי]] (cf. De 32:15).

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Pf. 3 ms. sf. [[נַשַּׁ֫נִי]] Ge 41:51 (E) God hath made me forget + acc. rei ([[]]—[[ַ]] in 1st syllable only here, infl. of [[מְנַשֶּׁה]] Ges:§ 52 m).

definitions.title: Hiph.
definitions.body: Pf. 3 ms. sf. [[הִשָּׁהּ]] [[חָכְמָה]] Job 39:17 God caused her (the ostrich) to forget wisdom, i.e. did not endow her with it. Impf. [[יַשֶּׁה לְ ְמִן־]] Job 11:6 Eloah allows a part of thy guilt to be forgotten thee, i.e. does not reckon it to thee in full (LXX = [[יִשְׁוֶה לְ ְמֵאֱלוֹהַּ]] [[כַּעֲוֹנְֶ֑]] [Du] there is equivalent to thee from Eloah, acc. to thine iniquity, cf. Bi Che:Job and Sol.; Bu reads [[נׇשָׁה]] for [[יַשֶּׁה]]; Du rejects ver. as gloss).
